  • Method Details

    • findResource

      public static <R> R findResource(String fileName, String fileExtension, Locale locale, Function<String,R> function)
      Finds and returns a localised resource, using the given function to validate it.

      The function is called for each resource until a non-null resource is returned or all resources are consumed. The resource name is built using the parameters fileName, fileExtension, and the given locale. The candidates and fallback locale are obtained from a ZapResourceBundleControl.

      For example, with the following parameters:

      • fileName - org.zaproxy.zap.file
      • fileExtension - ext
      • locale - es_ES
      and "en_GB" as fallback locale returned by the control, it would produce the following resource names: 
      
 org/zaproxy/zap/file_es_ES.ext
 org/zaproxy/zap/file_es.ext
 org/zaproxy/zap/file.ext
 org/zaproxy/zap/file_en_GB.ext
 org/zaproxy/zap/file_en.ext

      The function could be, for example, the instance method ClassLoader::getResource.

      Type Parameters:
      R - the type of the result.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the base file name.
      fileExtension - the file extension.
      locale - the target locale.
      function - the function that validates and returns the resource.
      Returns:
      the resource, or null if none found.
      Since:
      2.8.0

    • findResource

      public static <R> R findResource(ResourceBundle.Control control, String fileName, String fileExtension, Locale locale, Function<String,R> function)
      Finds and returns a localised resource, using the given function to validate it.

      The function is called for each resource until a non-null resource is returned or all resources are consumed. The resource name is built using the parameters fileName, fileExtension, and the given locale. The candidates and fallback locale are obtained from the given resource bundle control.

      For example, with the following parameters:

      • control - new ZapResourceBundleControl()
      • fileName - org.zaproxy.zap.file
      • fileExtension - ext
      • locale - es_ES
      and "en_GB" as fallback locale returned by the control, it would produce the following resource names: 
      
 org/zaproxy/zap/file_es_ES.ext
 org/zaproxy/zap/file_es.ext
 org/zaproxy/zap/file.ext
 org/zaproxy/zap/file_en_GB.ext
 org/zaproxy/zap/file_en.ext

      The function could be, for example, the instance method ClassLoader::getResource.

      Type Parameters:
      R - the type of the result.
      Parameters:
      control - the resource bundle control to obtain the candidate and fallback locales and build the resource names.
      fileName - the base file name.
      fileExtension - the file extension.
      locale - the target locale.
      function - the function that validates and returns the resource.
      Returns:
      the resource, or null if none found.
      Since:
      2.8.0

    • findResource

      public static <R> R findResource(String fileName, String fileExtension, String localeToken, Locale locale, Function<String,R> function)
      Finds and returns a localised resource, using the given function to validate it.

      The function is called for each resource until a non-null resource is returned or all resources are consumed. The resource name is built using the parameters fileName, fileExtension, and the given locale. The localeToken, if non- null nor empty, is replaced in the fileName with the current candidate locale. The candidates and fallback locale are obtained from a ZapResourceBundleControl.

      For example, with the following parameters:

      • fileName - org.zaproxy.zap.dir%LC%.file
      • fileExtension - ext
      • localeToken - %LC%
      • locale - es_ES
      and "en_GB" as fallback locale returned by the control, it would produce the following resource names: 
      
 org/zaproxy/zap/dir_es_ES/file_es_ES.ext
 org/zaproxy/zap/dir_es/file_es.ext
 org/zaproxy/zap/dir/file.ext
 org/zaproxy/zap/dir_en_GB/file_en_GB.ext
 org/zaproxy/zap/dir_en/file_en.ext

      The function could be, for example, the instance method ClassLoader::getResource.

      Type Parameters:
      R - the type of the result.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the base file name.
      fileExtension - the file extension.
      localeToken - the token that represents the locale, to be replaced in the fileName. Might be null.
      locale - the target locale.
      function - the function that validates and returns the resource.
      Returns:
      the resource, or null if none found.
      Since:
      2.8.0

    • findResource

      public static <R> R findResource(ResourceBundle.Control control, String fileName, String fileExtension, String localeToken, Locale locale, Function<String,R> function)
      Finds and returns a localised resource, using the given function to validate it.

      The function is called for each resource until a non-null resource is returned or all resources are consumed. The resource name is built using the parameters fileName, fileExtension, and the given locale. The localeToken, if non- null nor empty, is replaced in the fileName with the current candidate locale. The candidates and fallback locale are obtained from the given resource bundle control.

      For example, with the following parameters:

      • control - new ZapResourceBundleControl()
      • fileName - org.zaproxy.zap.dir%LC%.file
      • fileExtension - ext
      • localeToken - %LC%
      • locale - es_ES
      and "en_GB" as fallback locale returned by the control, it would produce the following resource names: 
      
 org/zaproxy/zap/dir_es_ES/file_es_ES.ext
 org/zaproxy/zap/dir_es/file_es.ext
 org/zaproxy/zap/dir/file.ext
 org/zaproxy/zap/dir_en_GB/file_en_GB.ext
 org/zaproxy/zap/dir_en/file_en.ext

      The function could be, for example, the instance method ClassLoader::getResource.

      Type Parameters:
      R - the type of the result.
      Parameters:
      control - the resource bundle control to obtain the candidate and fallback locales and build the resource names.
      fileName - the base file name.
      fileExtension - the file extension.
      localeToken - the token that represents the locale, to be replaced in the fileName. Might be null.
      locale - the target locale.
      function - the function that validates and returns the resource.
      Returns:
      the resource, or null if none found.
      Since:
      2.8.0

    • createMessagesPropertiesFilePattern

      public static Pattern createMessagesPropertiesFilePattern()
      Convenience method that calls the method #createResourceFilePattern(String, String), with parameters Constant.MESSAGES_PREFIX and Constant.MESSAGES_EXTENSION, respectively.
      Returns:
      a Pattern that matches the Messages.properties files of different Locales
      Since:
      2.4.0
      See Also:
      • createResourceFilesPattern(String, String)
      • Constant.MESSAGES_PREFIX
      • Constant.MESSAGES_EXTENSION

    • createResourceFilesRegex

      public static String createResourceFilesRegex(String fileName, String fileExtension)
      Returns a regular expression to match source and translated resource filenames with the given fileName and fileExtension.

      For example, with fileName as "Messages" and fileExtension as ".properties" the returned pattern would match:

      • Messages.properties
      • Messages_en.properties
      • Messages_en_GB.properties
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the resource files
      fileExtension - the extension of the resource files
      Returns:
      the regular expression to match resource filenames
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given fileName or fileExtension is null.
      Since:
      2.4.0
      See Also:
      • createResourceFilesPattern(String, String)
      • LANGUAGE_LOCALE_REGEX
      • COUNTRY_LOCALE_REGEX

    • createResourceFilesPattern

      public static Pattern createResourceFilesPattern(String fileName, String fileExtension)
      Returns a Pattern to match source and translated resource filenames with the given fileName and fileExtension.

      For example, with fileName as "Messages" and fileExtension as ".properties" the returned pattern would match:

      • Messages.properties
      • Messages_en.properties
      • Messages_en_GB.properties

      The pattern is case-sensitive.

      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the resource files
      fileExtension - the extension of the resource files
      Returns:
      the Pattern to match resource filenames
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given fileName or fileExtension is null.
      Since:
      2.4.0
      See Also:
      • createResourceFilesRegex(String, String)
      • LANGUAGE_LOCALE_REGEX
      • COUNTRY_LOCALE_REGEX

    • getAvailableLocales

      public static List<String> getAvailableLocales()
      Returns a list of languages and countries of the Locales (as String, for example "en_GB"), of default language and available translations.

      The list is sorted by language/country codes with default locale, always, at first position.

      Returns:
      The list of available translations, ZAP provides

    • getViewLocale

      public static ViewLocale getViewLocale(String locale)
      Convenience method that creates a ViewLocale with the given locale and a display name created by calling getLocalDisplayName(String), with the locale as argument.
      Parameters:
      locale - the locale that will used to create the ViewLocale
      Returns:
      the ViewLocale for the given locale
      Since:
      2.4.0
      See Also:
      • getLocalDisplayName(String)

    • getAvailableViewLocales

      public static List<ViewLocale> getAvailableViewLocales()
      Returns a list of ViewLocales, sorted by display name, of the default language and available translations.
      Returns:
      the ViewLocales of the default language and available translations.
      Since:
      2.4.0
      See Also:
      • ViewLocale

    • getLocalDisplayName

      public static String getLocalDisplayName(String locale)
      Gets the name of the language of and for the given locale.
      Parameters:
      locale - the locale whose language name will be returned
      Returns:
      the name of the language
